text: Arvonne S. Fraser (September 1, 1925 - August 7, 2018), was an American activist and educator. She was the Senior Fellow Emerita at the Humphrey Institute of Public Affairs, University of Minnesota and from 1993-1994 was the US Ambassador to the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women. Online version, subscription required. From 1980 to 1993, she was First Lady of Minneapolis, Minnesota. Fraser died on August 7, 2018 at a family retreat home near the St. Croix River in Hudson, Wisconsin at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American activists Category:Educators from Minneapolis Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Writers from Minneapolis Category:Politicians from Minneapolis
title: Arvonne Fraser
